title: Music For Memory
description: Music for Memory is an interactive data visualization project that explores how different types of music affect memory and stress responses. The project includes a user-driven memory quiz and dynamic D3.js visualizations to uncover individual cognitive patterns. Our goal was to personalize study music recommendations based on behavioral and physiological insights.

title: üö¥üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è BikeMap
description: Interactive map showing bike traffic across Boston and Cambridge with time filtering and traffic direction visualization.

title: Diabetes Risk Detection
description: An interactive data visualization project that investigates whether wearable device (eg. Apple watch) data, specifically heart rate patterns, can indicate diabetes risk. This project analyzes how heart rate trends differ between non-diabetic and prediabetic individuals, highlighting patterns such as the dawn phenomenon. Built with D3.js.

title: Diabetes Prediction Model
description: Developed a machine learning model to predict diabetes onset using XGBoost and Random Forest. Performed extensive data preprocessing, feature engineering, and hyperparameter tuning to optimize model performance. Achieved significant improvements in prediction accuracy by addressing class imbalance and refining key health indicators.

title: Airbnb Price Prediction Model
description: Built an XGBoost regression model to predict Airbnb listing prices using NYC dataset with 60+ features. Performed feature engineering, log transformations, and validation tuning to reduce RMSE to 87, outperforming the baseline by over 20%. Engineered new variables like review recency and extra guest fees to improve accuracy.

title: Impact of AI on the Workforce
description: Analyzed AI adoption and its effects on the labor market using data from kaggle and Stanford AI Index. Conducted hypothesis testing and regression analysis to assess salary impacts, automation risk, and job growth projections. Built classification models (Logistic Regression, SVM) and regression models (OLS, SVR) to predict job automation risk and salary trends.

title: Power Outages in the US
description: Analyzed and cleaned a dataset of US power outages, built a prediction model to estimate outage duration, developed a regression model evaluated by RMSE, created a static website with Jekyll and interactive visualizations, and conducted a fairness analysis to ensure unbiased performance across regions and customers.

title: Tesla Equity Valuation
description: Conducted a fundamental equity valuation of Tesla Inc. using base, upside, and downside scenarios based on analyst reports and management forecasts. Estimated a base case stock price of $86.85, with a valuation range between $59.15 and $133.59, highlighting discrepancies with the current market price driven by investor sentiment and growth expectations.
